title: Gleason Score for Prostate Cancer
desc: The Gleason Score for Prostate Cancer provides prognosis based on microscopic tumor appearance.

other_refer.text: Epstein JI, Allsbrook WC Jr, Amin MB, Egevad LL; ISUP Grading Committee. The 2005 International Society of Urological Pathology (ISUP) Consensus Conference on Gleason grading of prostatic carcinoma. Am J Surg Pathol 2005;29(9):1228-42.

data.evidence: Addition of primary, secondary and tertiary scores.
data.facts:
Grading System:

Gleason Score Prognostic Grade Group
Gleason score ≤6: I
Gleason score 3 + 4 = 7: II
Gleason score 4 + 3 = 7: III
Gleason score 8: IV
Gleason score 9-10: V

See below for the Gleason Score Diagram:

inputs.name: primary

options.label: Closely resembles normal prostate. Glands are small, well-formed, closely packed.
Increased stroma with well-formed glands, but larger with more tissue between them.
Recognizable glands, but cells are darker. Some cells have left the glands and are beginning to invade the surrounding tissue or have an infiltrative pattern.
Few recognizable glands. Many cells invading the surrounding tissue in clumps.
Few or no recognizable glands. Often sheets of cells throughout the surrounding tissue.

inputs.tips_en: The dominant pattern of the tumor (>50% of total pattern seen)

inputs.tips_en: The highest grade pattern seen after the primary pattern
